page.title: 07OCCUPATIONS IN GARTMORE
page.content: The Billet family have been{joiners for 3 generations, since 1910. Most of their wood comes from abroad. They mostly do repairs to houses in the villages around Gartmore, but they have built new houses. Tools have changed drastically and they use modern equipment and some standard factory-made fitments. The village joiner has always been the{undertaker, a difficult job when he knows many of the people who have died. Mr Whitelaw has been an{electrician for 50 years. He was apprenticed at 14 and has since worked in the village and about the area. He mostly does re- wiring houses. One of his first jobs was fitting strip lights in the school. Mr Matheson has been a{builder}for 13 years, building extensions and porches and fitting in windows.
